title: Practice Challenge
description:
Build a RESTful API for managing tasks using Hono patterns:

1. Create an array to store tasks (each has: id, title, completed)
2. Implement these endpoints using Hono's (c) context:
   - GET /api/tasks - Return all tasks using c.json()
   - GET /api/tasks/:id - Return one task (404 if not found)
   - POST /api/tasks - Create new task (validate title exists)
   - PUT /api/tasks/:id - Update task completely
   - DELETE /api/tasks/:id - Delete task

3. Use proper status codes with c.json(data, status):
   - 200 for successful GET/PUT
   - 201 for successful POST
   - 404 for not found
   - 400 for validation errors

4. Remember: return c.json() and use async for POST/PUT body parsing!

testCases.description: Should find task by id using Hono patterns

hints.text: Use c.req.param('id') to get the ID. For POST/PUT, use async and await c.req.json() to parse body. Always return c.json()!

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to return c.json() in Hono route handlers
commonMistakes.consequence: No response is sent to the client.
commonMistakes.correction: Always use return c.json(data) or return c.json(data, statusCode).

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using async/await for c.req.json() in POST/PUT handlers
commonMistakes.consequence: You get a Promise object instead of the parsed body.
commonMistakes.correction: Use async (c) => { const body = await c.req.json(); ... }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using Express syntax res.status(404).json() instead of Hono's c.json(data, 404)
commonMistakes.consequence: Code will not work with Hono's API.
commonMistakes.correction: In Hono, pass status as second argument: return c.json({ error: 'Not found' }, 404)
